questions.question_text:
A manufacturing company uses time and attendance in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

An employee discovers an error after a time and attendance record is approved and transferred. The payroll transfer has not been run. However, the time has been posted against the production order.

You need to reverse the transferred registrations.

What happens to the production order time posting?

choices.B: Negative values are offset through manual posting.
choices.A: The Production Report as Finished journal is posted.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You are the product design manager for a computer manufacturer.

Your new laptop model is configurable. There are restrictions on which hardware components can be selected depending on the model. You create configuration groups for hardware and software.

You need to create a new laptop item number and configurations.

In which order should you perform the actions? To answer, move all actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

HOTSPOT
-

A company manufactures high-end speaker systems. You have different configurations available for customers to customize features, including finishes and speaker materials. You have a product configuration model with bill of material lines and conditions for each component.

A customer can optionally add on protective covers, but only if a metal material is selected. If any other material is selected, the covers cannot be added. You add the following attributes:

//IMG//


You need to create an expression-based constraint that will only allow Corner Protection if Metal is selected.

How should you complete the expression? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
== is not used here as this constraint uses Implies 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/pim/expression-constraints-table-constraints-product-configuration-models
doesn't ==, Metal, = also gives same result?

comments.content: if ==, = ; metal material enforce the protective covers. But metal material can go with other option than protective covers. So should be !=, !

discussion.content:
Must be Backward scheduling
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/production-control/operations-scheduling

Finite material is correct

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

A construction company specializes in building residential and commercial structures. The company uses discrete manufacturing in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

The company has the following business requirements:

• Construction tasks must be scheduled based on the project delivery date.
• All raw components must be available when the job begins.

You need to configure job scheduling for each production order.

What should you configure? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

choices.D: Create a route with a runtime = 1, a process quantity = 1, and the operation's hours/time = 1.
choices.B: Create a route with a runtime = 1, a process quantity = 6, and the operation's hours/time = 1.
choices.A: Create a route with a runtime = 6, a process quantity = 1, and the operation's hours/time = 1.
choices.C: Create a route with a runtime = 10, a process quantity = 6, and the operation's hours/time = 1.

questions.question_text:
You are a process engineer evaluating Lean vs. Discrete processing. You want to convert a Kanban item.

This item has the following Lean setup:

• The setup uses a Lean schedule group with a throughput ratio = 2.
• The process activity tied to production flow has the following runtime activity times: time = 3 min, per quantity = 1.
• The work cell capacity has a model type of Throughput and an average throughput quantity of 60 per a capacity period of standard workday (8 hour day).
• The throughput is 10 per hour.

You need to set up a Discrete operation to mirror the item’s production flow activity.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Agree that you cannot answer correct to this one. We can state that it takes 6 min. to produce 1 pcs and one hour to produce 10 pcs.. In that context answer B must be the less wrong...

Selected Answer: A
This version of the question does not appear to have a correct answer. "A" seems to be the most correct option. See #60 & #86 for the correct answer options.
